title: (x) "Day of Silence" chunky '70s-style narrow sans - House Gothic 23 {Stephen L}
content:
I was wondering if anyone recognized the type used in the Day of Silence logo, available at (available at [http://dayofsilence.org/img/top\_right.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014609/http:/dayofsilence.org/img/top_right.jpg "http://dayofsilence.org/img/top\_right.jpg") ). I feel like I’ve seen that S, here, before, but can’t seem to find the post. It’s close to Adigo-Bold Two ( [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/primetype/adigo/bold-two/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014609/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/primetype/adigo/bold-two/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/primetype/adigo/bold-two/") ), but the S and Y are wrong.

Thanks,  
Andrew

 [‹ Bon Magazine from Sweden](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014609/http:/www.typophile.com/node/28384 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Marc Ecko logo - Trade Gothic {Pieter} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014609/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32530 "Go to next forum topic")
author: abpend

comments.content:
Do you think they just did custom “Y” and “f” glyphs, then? All of the other letters are spot-on. Thanks for your help.

Andrew

Scratch that. The “f” seems to come from Condensed Bold 1. Seems to be just the “Y.”

Andrew
The House Gothic 23 faces feature a good number of alternate glyphs to pimp yo’ headlines. ;^)
